revised_title: Observation of a Star-Like Appearance on the Dark Part of the Moon
tldr: In 1794, Thomas Stretton and William Wilkins observed a star-like appearance on the dark part of the moon. Their observations were analyzed by Nevil Maskelyne, who confirmed the time and location of the phenomenon. The star-like appearance was not related to the nearby bright star Aldebaran, which had an eclipse at the same time. The cause of this celestial phenomenon remains unknown.
